question: Based on the given evidence, is the hypothesis 'If ROUGE Dior Colored Lip Balm 999 either does not have "rosewood" in its official description or is refillable, then it neither has a satin-finish nor has "rosewood" in its official description.' true, false, or uncertain? The final answer should be 'True', 'False', or 'Uncertain'. Only answer 'Uncertain' if the reasoning results from different evidences conflict with each other.

content.source_1: Every velvet-finish lipstick in the Rouge Dior set (Lunar New Year Limited Edition) is refillable.
content.source_2: Every lipstick in that set has either a velvet finish or a satin finish.
content.source_3: Every satin-finish lipstick in the set has "rosewood" in its official description.
content.source_4: For any lipstick in the set, its official description either includes "rosewood" or does not include "rosewood."
content.source_5: ROUGE Dior Colored Lip Balm 999 is a lipstick in the Rouge Dior set (Lunar New Year Limited Edition).
content.source_6: ROUGE Dior Colored Lip Balm 999 either has "rosewood" in its official description or has a velvet finish.
content.source_7: ROUGE Dior Colored Lip Balm 999 cannot have a satin finish.
content.source_8: ROUGE Dior Colored Lip Balm 999 is not refillable.
